title: NA
text: creating new component: remind remove component R/components-generated.R remind remove binding inst/www/calcite-bindings.js create new binding inst/www/calcite-{component}.js add binding using htmltools::htmlDependency() R/action.R example: Component properties (except read-) must arguments Component slots must arguments MUST use add_slot() helper - see R/panel.R reference Ignore deprecated properties slots Bindings must register event New components must inst/examples/calcite-{component}.R file based calcite JS examples Always include devtools::load_all() top example create verbatimTextOutput() components reactive state emit events Create separate verbatimTextOutput() component reactive state renderPrint(), display raw reactive value directly: input$component_id NEVER construct custom lists extract specific properties - show full reactive object -Reference inst/examples/calcite-block.R pattern follow
code: action_binding <- htmltools::htmlDependency(     name = "calcite-action-binding",     version = calcite_version(),     src = c(file = system.file("www", package = "calcite")),     script = "calcite-action.js"   )

what: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
title: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
text: calcite package provides R bindings Esri’s Calcite Design System designed work directly shiny standalone html.

title: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
text: calcite package available GitHub. Install using following command

title: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
text: calcite consists many components. See official documntation. Use calcite components scaffold UI application. replicates navigation example.
code: library(calcite)  calcite_shell(   calcite_navigation(     slot = "header",     calcite_navigation_logo(       slot = "logo",       heading = "Snow Plow Map",       description = "City of AcmeCo"     ),     calcite_menu(       slot = "content-end",       calcite_menu_item(text = "Drivers", `icon-start` = "license", `text-enabled` = TRUE),       calcite_menu_item(text = "Routes", `icon-start` = "road-sign", `text-enabled` = TRUE),       calcite_menu_item(text = "Forecast", `icon-start` = "snow", `text-enabled` = TRUE)     ),     calcite_navigation(       slot = "navigation-secondary",       calcite_menu(         slot = "content-start",         calcite_menu_item(breadcrumb = TRUE, text = "All Routes", `icon-start` = "book", `text-enabled` = TRUE),         calcite_menu_item(breadcrumb = TRUE, text = "South Hills", `icon-start` = "apps", `text-enabled` = TRUE, active = TRUE)       )     ),     calcite_navigation_user(slot = "user", `full-name` = "Wendell Berry", username = "w_berry")   ) )

title: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
text: component attributes can set corresponding function. calcite_{component}() functions take ... argument. set attributes, must passed named values function. example use Calcite UI Icons, icon attribute must set.

title: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
text: properties component accessible via input argument shiny server function. can accessed format input${id}_{property}. returns list one element values. example calcite_block() created id block_container. open property can observed fetched using input$block_container_open.  Opening closing block writes console:
code: library(calcite)  ui <- calcite_shell(   calcite_block(     id = "block_container",     collapsible = TRUE,     heading = "Example Block",     calcite_notice(open = TRUE, div(slot = "message", "User layer effects sparingly, for emphasis"))   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$block_container_open, {     is_open <- input$block_container_open$values     cat(       sprintf("Calcite block is %s\n", ifelse(is_open, "open", "closed"))     )   }) }  shiny::shinyApp(ui, server) Listening on http://127.0.0.1:3086 Calcite block is open Calcite block is closed Calcite block is open Calcite block is closed

title: Bindings to the Calcite Design System JavaScript Component Library
text: Properties can updated using update_calcite() function requires id element update named values pass .... example create checkbox alert. checkbox checked show alert updating open property using update_calcite()
code: ui <- calcite_shell(   calcite_card(     heading = "Content",     calcite_label(       layout = "inline",       calcite_checkbox(id = "checked"),       "Click me"     )   ),   calcite_notice(     id = "initial-note",     div(slot = "title", "Nice!"),     div(slot = "message", "This is a success message")   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$checked_checked, {     checked <- input$checked_checked$values     # Update the `initial-note` property here     update_calcite("initial-note", open = checked)   }) }  shiny::shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion
text: ... One calcite_accordion_item() components id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) appearance Visual style: "solid" "transparent" (default: "solid") icon_position Placement icon header: "start" "end" (default: "end") icon_type Type icon header: "chevron", "caret", "plus-minus" (default: "chevron") scale Size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) (default: "m") selection_mode Selection mode: "multiple" allows number selections, "single" allows one selection, "single-persist" allows one selection prevents de-selection (default: "multiple")

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion

text: organize related text-based content. shorten pages reduce scrolling content crucial read full.

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion
text: Use Accordion contain related distinct, primarily text-based content. Use Accordion within main content area application save space. Avoid using Accordion within Panel. Instead, use one Block(s). Avoid using Accordion house interactive controls form-based components.

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion
text: accordion tracks items expanded based selection mode. Available properties input$id: $appearance - visual style $iconPosition - Icon placement $iconType - Icon type $scale - Size $selectionMode - Selection mode

title: Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion
Create a Calcite Accordion Component — calcite_accordion
code: # Basic accordion with multiple selection calcite_accordion(   id = "my_accordion",   calcite_accordion_item(     heading = "Watercraft",     description = "Yachts, boats, and dinghies",     icon_start = "embark",     "Recommended for coastal use"   ),   calcite_accordion_item(     heading = "Automobiles",     description = "Cars, trucks, and buses",     icon_start = "car",     "A good choice for inland adventure"   ) ) #> <calcite-accordion id="my_accordion"> #>   <calcite-accordion-item heading="Watercraft" description="Yachts, boats, and dinghies" icon-start="embark">Recommended for coastal use</calcite-accordion-item> #>   <calcite-accordion-item heading="Automobiles" description="Cars, trucks, and buses" icon-start="car">A good choice for inland adventure</calcite-accordion-item> #> </calcite-accordion>  # Single selection accordion calcite_accordion(   selection_mode = "single",   appearance = "transparent",   icon_type = "plus-minus",   calcite_accordion_item(     heading = "Section 1",     "Content 1"   ),   calcite_accordion_item(     heading = "Section 2",     "Content 2"   ) ) #> <calcite-accordion appearance="transparent" icon-type="plus-minus" selection-mode="single"> #>   <calcite-accordion-item heading="Section 1">Content 1</calcite-accordion-item> #>   <calcite-accordion-item heading="Section 2">Content 2</calcite-accordion-item> #> </calcite-accordion>

what: Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
title: Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
text: Creates action button can used within action bars action groups. Actions provide compact way trigger operations icon-based buttons.

title: Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
code: calcite_action(   text,   icon = NULL,   id = NULL,   active = NULL,   disabled = NULL,   indicator = NULL,   text_enabled = NULL,   scale = NULL,   alignment = NULL,   appearance = NULL,   loading = NULL,   label = NULL,   ... )

title: Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
text: text Text label action (required, also used accessibility) icon Icon name Calcite icon set id Optional ID action (required Shiny reactivity) active Whether action highlighted/selected disabled Whether action disabled indicator Whether show visual indicator (e.g., notification badge) text_enabled Whether display text label alongside icon scale Size action: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) alignment Text alignment: "start", "center", "end" appearance Visual style: "solid" "transparent" loading Whether show loading indicator label Custom accessibility label (defaults text provided) ... Additional attributes passed component

title: Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
text: used Shiny app, calcite_action() returns reactive list containing component properties. can observe entire component state watch individual properties: Available properties: $clicked - Boolean toggles click (use detect clicks) $active - Whether action currently active/highlighted $disabled - Whether action disabled $icon - icon name $text - text label $indicator - Whether indicator shown $alignment, $appearance, $scale, etc. - component properties Usage server:
code: # Watch for any change to the action (including clicks) observeEvent(input$my_action, {   print("Action changed!") })  # Watch only the clicked state observeEvent(input$my_action$clicked, {   print("Action was clicked!") })  # Access specific properties observeEvent(input$my_action, {   is_active <- input$my_action$active   click_state <- input$my_action$clicked })

title: Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
Create a Calcite Action Component — calcite_action
code: # Basic action with icon calcite_action(   text = "Layers",   icon = "layers",   id = "layers-action" ) #> <calcite-action id="layers-action" text="Layers" icon="layers"></calcite-action>  # Active action with text label calcite_action(   text = "Settings",   icon = "gear",   active = TRUE,   text_enabled = TRUE ) #> <calcite-action text="Settings" icon="gear" active="TRUE" text-enabled="TRUE"></calcite-action>  # Action with indicator calcite_action(   text = "Notifications",   icon = "bell",   indicator = TRUE ) #> <calcite-action text="Notifications" icon="bell" indicator="TRUE"></calcite-action>  # Shiny example if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)    ui <- calcite_shell(     calcite_action(       id = "my_action",       text = "Click me",       icon = "check",       text_enabled = TRUE     ),     verbatimTextOutput("status")   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     # Respond to clicks     observeEvent(input$my_action$clicked, {       message("Action clicked! State: ", input$my_action$clicked)     })      # Display all properties     output$status <- renderPrint({       input$my_action     })   }    shinyApp(ui, server) }

Child calcite_action() components content id Optional ID action group layout Layout style: "vertical", "horizontal", "grid" columns Number columns layout "grid" (1-6) scale Size group: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) expanded Whether group expanded label Accessibility label group slot Optional slot name (e.g., "bottom-actions" action bars)

Create a Calcite Action Group Component — calcite_action_group
code: # Basic action group with vertical layout calcite_action_group(   calcite_action(text = "Add", icon = "plus"),   calcite_action(text = "Edit", icon = "pencil"),   calcite_action(text = "Delete", icon = "trash") ) #> <calcite-action-group> #>   <calcite-action text="Add" icon="plus"></calcite-action> #>   <calcite-action text="Edit" icon="pencil"></calcite-action> #>   <calcite-action text="Delete" icon="trash"></calcite-action> #> </calcite-action-group>  # Horizontal group with custom scale calcite_action_group(   layout = "horizontal",   scale = "l",   calcite_action(text = "Save", icon = "save"),   calcite_action(text = "Cancel", icon = "x") ) #> <calcite-action-group layout="horizontal" scale="l"> #>   <calcite-action text="Save" icon="save"></calcite-action> #>   <calcite-action text="Cancel" icon="x"></calcite-action> #> </calcite-action-group>  # Grid layout with 2 columns calcite_action_group(   layout = "grid",   columns = 2,   calcite_action(text = "A", icon = "letter-a"),   calcite_action(text = "B", icon = "letter-b"),   calcite_action(text = "C", icon = "letter-c"),   calcite_action(text = "D", icon = "letter-d") ) #> <calcite-action-group layout="grid" columns="2"> #>   <calcite-action text="A" icon="letter-a"></calcite-action> #>   <calcite-action text="B" icon="letter-b"></calcite-action> #>   <calcite-action text="C" icon="letter-c"></calcite-action> #>   <calcite-action text="D" icon="letter-d"></calcite-action> #> </calcite-action-group>

what: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert

title: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
code: calcite_alert(   kind = NULL,   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   open = NULL,   icon = TRUE,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   auto_close = NULL,   auto_close_duration = NULL,   placement = NULL,   queue = NULL,   scale = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   title = NULL,   message = NULL,   link = NULL,   actions_end = NULL )  calcite_alert_brand(   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   open = NULL,   icon = TRUE,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   auto_close = NULL,   auto_close_duration = NULL,   placement = NULL,   queue = NULL,   scale = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   title = NULL,   message = NULL,   link = NULL,   actions_end = NULL )  calcite_alert_danger(   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   open = NULL,   icon = TRUE,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   auto_close = NULL,   auto_close_duration = NULL,   placement = NULL,   queue = NULL,   scale = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   title = NULL,   message = NULL,   link = NULL,   actions_end = NULL )  calcite_alert_info(   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   open = NULL,   icon = TRUE,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   auto_close = NULL,   auto_close_duration = NULL,   placement = NULL,   queue = NULL,   scale = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   title = NULL,   message = NULL,   link = NULL,   actions_end = NULL )  calcite_alert_success(   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   open = NULL,   icon = TRUE,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   auto_close = NULL,   auto_close_duration = NULL,   placement = NULL,   queue = NULL,   scale = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   title = NULL,   message = NULL,   link = NULL,   actions_end = NULL )  calcite_alert_warning(   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   open = NULL,   icon = TRUE,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   auto_close = NULL,   auto_close_duration = NULL,   placement = NULL,   queue = NULL,   scale = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   title = NULL,   message = NULL,   link = NULL,   actions_end = NULL )

title: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
text: kind Specifies kind alert: "brand", "danger", "info", "success", "warning" (default: "brand") ... Child content alert id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) label Accessible name component (required) open true, displays positions component (default: FALSE) icon TRUE, shows default recommended icon. Alternatively, pass Calcite UI Icon name display specific icon icon_flip_rtl TRUE, icon flipped element direction right--left auto_close TRUE, component closes automatically. Recommended passive, non-blocking alerts (default: FALSE) auto_close_duration Duration auto-close: "fast", "medium", "slow" (default: "medium") placement Placement component: "top", "top-start", "top-end", "bottom", "bottom-start", "bottom-end" (default: "bottom") queue Ordering priority opened: "immediate", "last", "next" (default: "last") scale Size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) (default: "m") numbering_system Unicode numeral system localization: "arab", "arabext", "latn" title Content title slot message Content message slot link Content link slot (typically calcite_link()) actions_end Content actions-end slot (typically calcite_action() components)

title: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
text: visually similar Notice, Alert distinct capabilities intended use cases: Alert: Best ephemeral, workflow-specific messaging Generally open page load often displayed result user interaction Positioned absolutely content Notice: Best informative, contextually relevant information Can open page load, displayed result user action Can persisted interface made closable Modal: Best long-form messaging narrative content Can contain media interactive elements Generally presented result user invocation

title: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
text: Alerts meant quickly convey message user. Keep copy short point. Consistent Alert structure, verbiage, copy ensures users expected experience.

title: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
text: Available properties input$id: $open - Whether alert currently displayed $kind - alert kind component properties Events: calciteAlertBeforeClose - closing transition begins calciteAlertBeforeOpen - opening transition begins calciteAlertClose - close animation completes calciteAlertOpen - open animation completes

title: Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
Create a Calcite Alert Component — calcite_alert
code:
# Basic success alert calcite_alert_success( label = "Success", icon = "smile", open = TRUE, title = "Everything worked out!", message = "Take a moment to reflect on your day" ) #> #>
Everything worked out!
#>
Take a moment to reflect on your day
#> # Alert with link calcite_alert_info( label = "Notification", open = TRUE, title = "Something interesting just happened", message = "We thought you might want to take a look", link = calcite_link("Take action", href = "#") ) #> #>
Something interesting just happened
#>
We thought you might want to take a look
#> Take action #>

text: ... Child content block id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) heading Header text block description Description text displayed heading collapsible Whether block can collapsed (default: FALSE) expanded Whether block currently expanded (default: FALSE) disabled Whether interaction prevented (default: FALSE) loading Whether display busy indicator (default: FALSE) icon_start Icon display start header icon_end Icon display end header icon_flip_rtl Flip icons RTL languages: "start", "end", "" scale Size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) heading_level Semantic heading level (1-6) accessibility label Accessible name component drag_disabled Prevent dragging parent Block Group enables (default: FALSE) sort_handle_open Display position sort handle (default: FALSE) menu_placement Placement action menu overlay_positioning Positioning type overlaid content: "absolute" "fixed"

title: Create a Calcite Block Component — calcite_block
Create a Calcite Block Component — calcite_block
text: block emits events expanded collapsed, making easy track state. Available properties input$id: $expanded - Whether block currently expanded $collapsible - Whether block collapsible $disabled - Whether block disabled $heading - heading text component properties Basic usage:   Update server:
code: calcite_block(   id = "my_block",   heading = "Layer effects",   description = "Adjust blur, highlight, and more",   collapsible = TRUE,   expanded = TRUE,   icon_start = "effects",   # Block content... )  # In server observeEvent(input$my_block$expanded, {   if (input$my_block$expanded) {     message("Block was expanded")   } else {     message("Block was collapsed")   } }) # Programmatically expand or collapse the block update_calcite("my_block", expanded = TRUE) update_calcite("my_block", expanded = FALSE)

what: Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
title: Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
text: Creates interactive button component can used user actions. Buttons can display text, icons, , support various visual styles.

title: Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
code: calcite_button(   ...,   id = NULL,   alignment = NULL,   appearance = NULL,   disabled = NULL,   download = NULL,   form = NULL,   href = NULL,   icon_end = NULL,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   icon_start = NULL,   kind = NULL,   label = NULL,   loading = NULL,   name = NULL,   rel = NULL,   round = NULL,   scale = NULL,   split_child = NULL,   target = NULL,   type = NULL,   width = NULL )

title: Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
text: ... Content button (default slot) - typically text elements id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) alignment Specifies alignment component's elements: "center", "end", "icon-end-space-", "icon-start-space-", "space-", "start" (default: "center") appearance Specifies appearance style: "outline", "outline-fill", "solid", "transparent" (default: "solid") disabled TRUE, interaction prevented component displayed lower opacity (default: FALSE) download Prompts user save linked URL instead navigating . Can TRUE string filename form id form associated component href Specifies URL linked resource (absolute relative path) icon_end Specifies icon display end component icon_flip_rtl Displays iconStart /iconEnd flipped element direction RTL: "", "end", "start" icon_start Specifies icon display start component kind Specifies kind component: "brand", "danger", "inverse", "neutral" (default: "brand") label Accessible name component loading TRUE, busy indicator displayed (default: FALSE) name Specifies name component form submission rel Defines relationship href value current document round TRUE, adds round style component (default: FALSE) scale Specifies size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) (default: "m") split_child Specifies component child calcite-split-button: "primary", "secondary", boolean target Specifies open linked document defined href type Specifies default behavior: "button", "reset", "submit" (default: "button") width Specifies width component: "auto", "full", "half" (default: "auto"). Note: "half" deprecated, use "full" instead.

title: Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
text: used Shiny app, calcite_button() returns reactive list containing component properties click counter. can observe entire component state watch individual properties: Available properties: $clicks - Integer count many times button clicked $alignment, $appearance, $disabled, $kind, $scale, etc. - component properties Usage server:
code: # Watch for button clicks using the clicks counter observeEvent(input$my_button$clicks, {   print(paste("Button clicked", input$my_button$clicks, "times")) })  # Or watch for any change to the button observeEvent(input$my_button, {   print("Button changed!") })  # Access specific properties observeEvent(input$my_button, {   is_disabled <- input$my_button$disabled   click_count <- input$my_button$clicks })

title: Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
Create a Calcite Button Component — calcite_button
code: # Basic button calcite_button(   id = "my_button",   "Click Me!" ) #> <calcite-button id="my_button">Click Me!</calcite-button>  # Button with icon calcite_button(   "Save",   icon_start = "save",   appearance = "solid",   kind = "brand" ) #> <calcite-button appearance="solid" icon-start="save" kind="brand">Save</calcite-button>  # Outline button with icon at end calcite_button(   "Delete",   icon_end = "trash",   appearance = "outline",   kind = "danger" ) #> <calcite-button appearance="outline" icon-end="trash" kind="danger">Delete</calcite-button>  # Round icon-only button calcite_button(   icon_start = "plus",   round = TRUE,   label = "Add item" ) #> <calcite-button icon-start="plus" label="Add item" round="TRUE"></calcite-button>  # Shiny example if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)    ui <- div(     calcite_button(       id = "test_button",       "Click Me!",       appearance = "solid",       kind = "brand"     ),     verbatimTextOutput("click_count")   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     # Watch for button clicks     output$click_count <- renderText({       paste("Button clicked", input$test_button$clicks, "times")     })   }    shinyApp(ui, server) }

what: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
title: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker

title: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
code: calcite_date_picker(   id = NULL,   value = NULL,   range = NULL,   min = NULL,   max = NULL,   scale = NULL,   layout = NULL,   calendars = NULL,   active_range = NULL,   heading_level = NULL,   month_style = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   proximity_selection_disabled = NULL,   ... )

title: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
text: id Optional ID date picker (required Shiny reactivity) value Selected date string ("yyyy-mm-dd"), array strings range values range TRUE, activates range mode allow start end dates (default: FALSE) min Earliest allowed date ("yyyy-mm-dd") max Latest allowed date ("yyyy-mm-dd") scale Specifies size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) layout Defines layout: "horizontal" "vertical" calendars Number calendars displayed range TRUE: 1 2 (default: 2) active_range range TRUE, specifies active range: "start" "end" heading_level Heading level document structure (1-6) month_style Month display style: "wide" (default) "abbreviated" numbering_system Unicode numeral system: "latn", "arab", "arabext" proximity_selection_disabled TRUE, disables default range narrowing behavior (default: FALSE) ... Additional attributes passed component

title: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
text: Dates provided strings "yyyy-mm-dd" format range mode, provide array: c("2024-01-15", "2024-01-20") component always returns dates array strings, even single date mode

title: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
text: used Shiny app id, calcite_date_picker() returns reactive list containing component properties. Available properties: $value - Array selected date strings (always array, even single dates) $range - Whether range mode enabled $min - Minimum allowed date $max - Maximum allowed date component properties Usage server:
code: # Single date mode observeEvent(input$my_date$value, {   selected_date <- input$my_date$value[1]  # Get first (and only) date   message("Selected: ", selected_date) })  # Range mode observeEvent(input$my_date_range$value, {   start_date <- input$my_date_range$value[1]   end_date <- input$my_date_range$value[2]   message("Range: ", start_date, " to ", end_date) })

title: Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
Create a Calcite Date Picker Component — calcite_date_picker
code: # Basic date picker calcite_date_picker(   id = "my_date" ) #> <calcite-date-picker id="my_date"></calcite-date-picker>  # Date picker with initial value calcite_date_picker(   id = "event_date",   value = "2024-12-25" ) #> <calcite-date-picker id="event_date" value="2024-12-25"></calcite-date-picker>  # Date picker with min/max constraints calcite_date_picker(   id = "booking_date",   min = "2024-01-01",   max = "2024-12-31" ) #> <calcite-date-picker id="booking_date" min="2024-01-01" max="2024-12-31"></calcite-date-picker>  # Range date picker calcite_date_picker(   id = "date_range",   range = TRUE,   value = c("2024-01-15", "2024-01-20") ) #> <calcite-date-picker id="date_range" value="["2024-01-15","2024-01-20"]" range="TRUE"></calcite-date-picker>

text: ... Content message (default slot) - typically text textOutput() status Status message: "idle", "valid", "invalid" (default: "idle") icon Specifies icon display (TRUE default icon name) icon_flip_rtl TRUE, icon flipped RTL direction (default: FALSE) scale Size component: "s", "m", "l" (default: "m") id Component ID (optional)

title: Create a Calcite Input Message Component — calcite_input_message
text: "valid": Green checkmark icon, success message "invalid": Red warning icon, error message "idle": Default state, informational message

title: Create a Calcite Input Message Component — calcite_input_message
text: Use textOutput() slot renderText() server create dynamic validation messages. Use update_calcite() change status/icon properties.

title: Create a Calcite Input Message Component — calcite_input_message
Create a Calcite Input Message Component — calcite_input_message
code: # Static message calcite_input_message(   "Username is available",   status = "valid",   icon = TRUE ) #> <calcite-input-message status="valid" icon="TRUE">Username is available</calcite-input-message>  # Dynamic message with textOutput calcite_input_message(   textOutput("validation_msg"),   status = "invalid",   icon = "exclamation-mark-circle",   id = "msg" ) #> Error in textOutput("validation_msg"): could not find function "textOutput"  # With input in a label calcite_label(   label = "Username",   calcite_input_text(     id = "username",     placeholder = "Enter username"   ),   calcite_input_message(     "Username must be 3-20 characters",     status = "idle"   ) ) #> <calcite-label> #>   Username #>   <calcite-input-text id="username" placeholder="Enter username"></calcite-input-text> #>   <calcite-input-message status="idle">Username must be 3-20 characters</calcite-input-message> #> </calcite-label>

code: calcite_input_number(   id = NULL,   value = NULL,   name = NULL,   placeholder = NULL,   label = NULL,   label_text = NULL,   alignment = NULL,   autocomplete = NULL,   clearable = NULL,   disabled = NULL,   form = NULL,   group_separator = NULL,   icon = NULL,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   integer = NULL,   loading = NULL,   max = NULL,   min = NULL,   number_button_type = NULL,   numbering_system = NULL,   prefix_text = NULL,   read_only = NULL,   required = NULL,   scale = NULL,   status = NULL,   step = NULL,   suffix_text = NULL,   validation_icon = NULL,   validation_message = NULL,   action = NULL,   label_content = NULL )

title: Create a Calcite Input Number Component — calcite_input_number
text: id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) value component's value name Specifies name component (required form submission) placeholder Specifies placeholder text component label Accessible name component label_text provided, displays label text component alignment Text alignment value: "start", "center", "end" (default: "start") autocomplete Type content autocomplete forms clearable TRUE, shows clear button component value (default: FALSE) disabled TRUE, interaction prevented displayed lower opacity (default: FALSE) form id form associated component group_separator TRUE, number values display group separator corresponding language country format (default: FALSE) icon Specifies icon display (TRUE default icon name) icon_flip_rtl TRUE, icon flipped RTL direction (default: FALSE) integer TRUE, restricts component integer numbers disables exponential notation (default: FALSE) loading TRUE, displays busy indicator (default: FALSE) max Maximum value input min Minimum value input number_button_type Placement increment/decrement buttons: "vertical", "horizontal", "none" (default: "vertical") numbering_system Unicode numeral system: "arab", "arabext", "latn" prefix_text Text display start component read_only TRUE, value can read modified (default: FALSE) required TRUE, must value form submission (default: FALSE) scale Size component: "s", "m", "l" (default: "m") status Status input field: "idle", "valid", "invalid" (default: "idle") step Granularity value must adhere (can "" number) suffix_text Text display end component validation_icon Validation icon display (TRUE icon name) validation_message Validation message display action Content action slot (typically calcite_action) label_content Content label-content slot

title: Create a Calcite Input Number Component — calcite_input_number
Create a Calcite Input Number Component — calcite_input_number
text: used Shiny app, calcite_input_number() returns reactive list containing: Available properties: $value - current numeric value (string) $validity - Object containing validation state (valid, badInput, rangeOverflow, etc.) $status - Current status ("idle", "valid", "invalid") component properties Usage server:
code: # Watch for value changes observeEvent(input$age$value, {   age_num <- as.numeric(input$age$value)   print(paste("Age:", age_num)) })  # Check validity observeEvent(input$age, {   if (input$age$validity$valid) {     print("Valid number entered")   }   if (input$age$validity$rangeOverflow) {     print("Number is too large")   } })

title: Create a Calcite Input Number Component — calcite_input_number
Create a Calcite Input Number Component — calcite_input_number
code: # Basic number input calcite_input_number(   id = "quantity",   placeholder = "Enter quantity" ) #> <calcite-input-number id="quantity" placeholder="Enter quantity"></calcite-input-number>  # Integer-only input with constraints calcite_input_number(   id = "age",   integer = TRUE,   min = 0,   max = 120,   step = 1,   required = TRUE ) #> <calcite-input-number id="age" integer="TRUE" max="120" min="0" required="TRUE" step="1"></calcite-input-number>  # Price input with formatting calcite_input_number(   id = "price",   prefix_text = "$",   group_separator = TRUE,   step = 0.01,   min = 0 ) #> <calcite-input-number id="price" group-separator="TRUE" min="0" prefix-text="$" step="0.01"></calcite-input-number>  # Percentage input calcite_input_number(   id = "percent",   suffix_text = "%",   min = 0,   max = 100,   step = 1 ) #> <calcite-input-number id="percent" max="100" min="0" step="1" suffix-text="%"></calcite-input-number>

title: Create a Calcite Input Text Component — calcite_input_text
text: id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) value component's value name Specifies name component (required form submission) placeholder Specifies placeholder text component label Accessible name component label_text provided, displays label text component alignment Text alignment value: "start", "center", "end" (default: "start") autocomplete Type content autocomplete forms clearable TRUE, shows clear button component value (default: FALSE) disabled TRUE, interaction prevented displayed lower opacity (default: FALSE) form id form associated component icon Specifies icon display (TRUE default icon name) icon_flip_rtl TRUE, icon flipped RTL direction (default: FALSE) loading TRUE, displays busy indicator (default: FALSE) max_length Maximum length text component's value min_length Minimum length text component's value pattern Regular expression pattern value must match validation prefix_text Text display start component read_only TRUE, value can read modified (default: FALSE) required TRUE, must value form submission (default: FALSE) scale Size component: "s", "m", "l" (default: "m") status Status input field: "idle", "valid", "invalid" (default: "idle") suffix_text Text display end component validation_icon Validation icon display (TRUE icon name) validation_message Validation message display action Content action slot (typically calcite_action) label_content Content label-content slot

title: Create a Calcite Input Text Component — calcite_input_text
Create a Calcite Input Text Component — calcite_input_text
text: used Shiny app, calcite_input_text() returns reactive list containing: Available properties: $value - current text value $validity - Object containing validation state (valid, tooLong, tooShort, patternMismatch, etc.) $status - Current status ("idle", "valid", "invalid") component properties Usage server:
code: # Watch for value changes observeEvent(input$username$value, {   print(paste("Username:", input$username$value)) })  # Check validity observeEvent(input$username, {   if (input$username$validity$valid) {     print("Valid username entered")   }   if (input$username$validity$tooShort) {     print("Username is too short")   } })

code: # Basic text input calcite_input_text(   id = "username",   placeholder = "Enter username" ) #> <calcite-input-text id="username" placeholder="Enter username"></calcite-input-text>  # Text input with length constraints calcite_input_text(   id = "username",   min_length = 3,   max_length = 20,   required = TRUE ) #> <calcite-input-text id="username" max-length="20" min-length="3" required="TRUE"></calcite-input-text>  # Text input with pattern validation calcite_input_text(   id = "zip_code",   pattern = "\\d{5}",   placeholder = "12345" ) #> <calcite-input-text id="zip_code" placeholder="12345" pattern="\d{5}"></calcite-input-text>  # Search input with icon calcite_input_text(   id = "search",   icon = "search",   clearable = TRUE,   placeholder = "Search..." ) #> <calcite-input-text id="search" placeholder="Search..." clearable="TRUE" icon="search"></calcite-input-text>

text: Use Links : Navigation another page section Tertiary-level actions group Inline actions within sentences Use Buttons instead : Primary actions like "Create", "Submit", "Upload" Task completion actions Prominent calls action

title: Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
text: ... Child content slots (title, message, link, actions-end) id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) open Whether notice visible (default: FALSE) closable Whether show close button (default: FALSE) icon Show default icon (TRUE) specific icon name (string) icon_flip_rtl Flip icon RTL languages (default: FALSE) kind Type notice: "brand", "danger", "info", "success", "warning" scale Size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) width Width behavior: "auto" "full" (note: "half" deprecated)

title: Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
text: notice emits events opened closed, making easy track state respond user dismissals. Available properties input$id: $open - Whether notice currently visible $closable - Whether notice can closed $kind - type notice component properties Basic usage:   Show/hide server:
code: calcite_notice(   id = "my_notice",   open = TRUE,   closable = TRUE,   kind = "success",   icon = TRUE,   div(slot = "title", "Success!"),   div(slot = "message", "Your changes have been saved.") )  # In server - detect when user closes the notice observeEvent(input$my_notice$open, {   if (!input$my_notice$open) {     message("User dismissed the notice")   } }) # Show a notice update_calcite("my_notice", open = TRUE)  # Hide a notice update_calcite("my_notice", open = FALSE)

title: Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
text: notice supports several slots organizing content: title: notice title message: notice message link: calcite-action links like "Read " actions-end: Additional actions (recommended: 2 fewer)

title: Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
text: Use informative, contextually relevant information Can open page load shown based user action Can persistent closable Use appropriate kind convey message severity

title: Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
Create a Calcite Notice Component — calcite_notice
code: # Basic notice calcite_notice(   open = TRUE,   icon = TRUE,   closable = TRUE,   div(slot = "title", "New feature available"),   div(slot = "message", "Check out the reporting dashboard") ) #> Error in div(slot = "title", "New feature available"): could not find function "div"  # Notice with specific icon and kind calcite_notice(   open = TRUE,   kind = "danger",   icon = "exclamation-mark-triangle",   div(slot = "title", "Error in form"),   div(slot = "message", "Please correct the highlighted fields") ) #> Error in div(slot = "title", "Error in form"): could not find function "div"  # Notice with action link calcite_notice(   open = TRUE,   icon = "layers-reference",   div(slot = "title", "Try this trick"),   div(slot = "message", "Select multiple layers at once"),   calcite_link(slot = "link", title = "my action", "Read more") ) #> Error in div(slot = "title", "Try this trick"): could not find function "div"  # Shiny example with server control if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)    ui <- calcite_shell(     calcite_panel(       heading = "Notice Demo",        calcite_notice(         id = "my_notice",         open = FALSE,         closable = TRUE,         kind = "success",         icon = TRUE,         div(slot = "title", "Success!"),         div(slot = "message", "Your action completed successfully")       ),        calcite_button(         id = "show_notice",         "Show Notice"       ),        verbatimTextOutput("notice_status")     )   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     # Show notice when button clicked     observeEvent(input$show_notice$clicked, {       update_calcite("my_notice", open = TRUE)     })      # Track notice state     output$notice_status <- renderPrint({       list(         is_open = input$my_notice$open,         kind = input$my_notice$kind       )     })   }    shinyApp(ui, server) }

Main content panel (default slot) id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) heading Header text panel description Description text displayed heading closable Whether display close button header (default: FALSE) closed Whether component hidden (default: FALSE) collapsed Whether content area hidden (default: FALSE) collapse_direction Direction collapse icon: "" "" (default: "") collapsible Whether panel can collapsed (default: FALSE) disabled Whether interaction prevented (default: FALSE) heading_level Semantic heading level (1-6) accessibility icon Icon display header icon_flip_rtl Flip icon RTL languages (default: FALSE) loading Whether display busy indicator (default: FALSE) menu_flip_placements Fallback placements menu space insufficient menu_open Whether action menu items open (default: FALSE) menu_placement Placement action menu (default: "bottom-end") message_overrides Override individual strings used component overlay_positioning Positioning type overlaid content: "absolute" "fixed" (default: "absolute") scale Size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) (default: "m") action_bar Content action-bar slot (typically calcite_action_bar()) alerts Content alerts slot (typically calcite_alert() components) content_bottom Content main slot footer content_top Content main slot action-bar header_actions_start Actions content start header header_actions_end Actions content end header header_content Custom content header header_menu_actions Overflow menu actions (typically calcite_dropdown()) fab Floating action button (typically calcite_fab()) footer Custom content footer (use footer_start/footer_end) footer_start Leading footer content (use footer slot) footer_end Trailing footer content (use footer slot)

text: ... calcite-option components (default slot). Ignored values provided. values Character vector option values. provided, options automatically generated values labels. NULL, uses values labels. id Component ID (required Shiny reactivity) label Accessible name component (required) disabled true, interaction prevented component displayed lower opacity form id form associated component label_text provided, displays label text component message_overrides Override individual strings used component name Specifies name component. Required pass component's value form submission required true, component must value form submit scale Specifies size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) status Specifies status input field: "idle", "invalid", "valid" validation_icon Specifies validation icon display component validation_message Specifies validation message display component value component's selectedOption value width Specifies width component: "auto", "full", "half" (half deprecated) label_content Content render next component's labelText (slot)

text: used Shiny app, calcite_select() returns reactive list containing component's state. component emits calciteSelectChange event selection changes. title: Create a Calcite Select Component — calcite_select
Create a Calcite Select Component — calcite_select
code: # Using values and labels vectors (convenient) calcite_select(   id = "my_select",   label = "Choose terrain type",   values = c("mountains", "rivers", "lakes", "buttes", "fjords"),   labels = c("Mountains", "Rivers", "Lakes", "Buttes", "Fjords") ) #> <calcite-select id="my_select" label="Choose terrain type"> #>   <calcite-option label="Mountains" value="mountains"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Rivers" value="rivers"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Lakes" value="lakes"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Buttes" value="buttes"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Fjords" value="fjords"></calcite-option> #> </calcite-select>  # Using values only (labels default to values) calcite_select(   id = "simple_select",   label = "Choose an option",   values = c("option1", "option2", "option3") ) #> <calcite-select id="simple_select" label="Choose an option"> #>   <calcite-option label="option1" value="option1"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="option2" value="option2"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="option3" value="option3"></calcite-option> #> </calcite-select>  # Manually constructing options (more control) calcite_select(   id = "fruit_select",   label = "Choose a fruit",   label_text = "Select your favorite fruit",   scale = "m",   calcite_option(label = "Apple", value = "apple"),   calcite_option(label = "Banana", value = "banana", selected = TRUE),   calcite_option(label = "Orange", value = "orange") ) #> <calcite-select id="fruit_select" label="Choose a fruit" label-text="Select your favorite fruit" scale="m"> #>   <calcite-option label="Apple" value="apple"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Banana" value="banana" selected="TRUE"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Orange" value="orange"></calcite-option> #> </calcite-select>  # Required select with validation calcite_select(   id = "required_select",   label = "Required field",   label_text = "Make a selection",   required = TRUE,   status = "invalid",   validation_message = "Please select an option",   calcite_option(label = "Choose...", value = ""),   calcite_option(label = "Option A", value = "a"),   calcite_option(label = "Option B", value = "b") ) #> <calcite-select id="required_select" label="Required field" label-text="Make a selection" required="TRUE" status="invalid" validation-message="Please select an option"> #>   <calcite-option label="Choose..." value=""></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Option A" value="a"></calcite-option> #>   <calcite-option label="Option B" value="b"></calcite-option> #> </calcite-select>

title: Create a Calcite Slider Component — calcite_slider
Create a Calcite Slider Component — calcite_slider
text: slider emits two types events: calciteSliderChange - Fires user releases handle (debounced, final value) calciteSliderInput - Fires continuously drag (use caution expensive operations) Available properties input$id: $value - Current value (single slider) array [minValue, maxValue] (range slider) $min / $max - Slider bounds $step - Step increment $disabled - Whether disabled component properties Single-value slider:   Range slider (dual handles):   Update server:
code: observeEvent(input$my_slider, {   current_value <- input$my_slider$value   print(paste("Slider value:", current_value)) }) # Provide both min_value and max_value to create a range slider calcite_slider(   id = "range_slider",   min = 0,   max = 100,   min_value = 20,   max_value = 80 )  observeEvent(input$range_slider, {   lower <- input$range_slider$minValue   upper <- input$range_slider$maxValue   print(paste("Range:", lower, "to", upper)) }) # Update single value update_calcite("my_slider", value = 50)  # Update range update_calcite("range_slider", minValue = 30, maxValue = 70)

title: Create a Calcite Slider Component — calcite_slider
Create a Calcite Slider Component — calcite_slider
code: # Basic slider calcite_slider(   id = "my_slider",   value = 50,   min = 0,   max = 100,   step = 5 ) #> <calcite-slider id="my_slider" value="50" min="0" max="100" step="5" has-histogram="FALSE"></calcite-slider>  # Slider with ticks and labels calcite_slider(   id = "temperature",   value = 72,   min = 32,   max = 212,   step = 1,   ticks = 10,   label_handles = TRUE,   label_ticks = TRUE ) #> <calcite-slider id="temperature" value="72" min="32" max="212" step="1" label-handles="TRUE" label-ticks="TRUE" ticks="10" has-histogram="FALSE"></calcite-slider>  # Range slider (dual handles) calcite_slider(   id = "price_range",   min = 0,   max = 1000,   min_value = 100,   max_value = 500,   step = 10,   label_handles = TRUE ) #> <calcite-slider id="price_range" min="0" max="1000" step="10" min-value="100" max-value="500" label-handles="TRUE" has-histogram="FALSE"></calcite-slider>  # Shiny example if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)    ui <- calcite_shell(     calcite_card(       heading = "Slider Example",       calcite_label(         "Choose a value",         calcite_slider(           id = "my_slider",           value = 50,           min = 0,           max = 100,           step = 5,           label_handles = TRUE         )       ),       verbatimTextOutput("slider_value")     )   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     output$slider_value <- renderPrint({       paste("Current value:", input$my_slider$value)     })   }    shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Create a Calcite Switch Component — calcite_switch
Create a Calcite Switch Component — calcite_switch
code: # Basic switch calcite_switch(   id = "my_switch",   label = "Enable 3D mode" ) #> <calcite-switch id="my_switch" label="Enable 3D mode"></calcite-switch>  # Switch with label text on both sides calcite_switch(   id = "theme_switch",   label_text_start = "Light",   label_text_end = "Dark",   label = "Theme toggle" ) #> <calcite-switch id="theme_switch" label="Theme toggle" label-text-end="Dark" label-text-start="Light"></calcite-switch>  # Checked switch at large scale calcite_switch(   checked = TRUE,   scale = "l",   label = "Notifications" ) #> <calcite-switch checked="TRUE" label="Notifications" scale="l"></calcite-switch>  # Shiny example if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)    ui <- calcite_shell(     calcite_panel(       heading = "Switch Example",        calcite_label(         layout = "inline",         "3D Off",         calcite_switch(id = "mode_switch"),         "3D On"       ),        verbatimTextOutput("status")     )   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     # Display switch state     output$status <- renderPrint({       input$mode_switch     })   }    shinyApp(ui, server) }

what: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
title: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
text: Tiles presentational components useful presenting consequential information compact, consistent format. can contain supportive icons, heading, description.

title: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
code: calcite_tile(   ...,   id = NULL,   heading = NULL,   description = NULL,   icon = NULL,   href = NULL,   active = NULL,   selected = NULL,   disabled = NULL,   alignment = NULL,   scale = NULL,   icon_flip_rtl = NULL,   label = NULL,   content_top = NULL,   content_bottom = NULL )

title: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
text: ... Child content tile id Optional ID tile (required Shiny reactivity) heading component header text description description component, displays heading icon Specifies icon display href provided, URL component (makes tile link) active TRUE, component active (default: FALSE) selected TRUE parent's selectionMode allows , component selected (default: FALSE) disabled TRUE, interaction prevented component displays lower opacity (default: FALSE) alignment Specifies alignment tile's content: "start" "center" scale Specifies size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) icon_flip_rtl TRUE, icon flipped element direction RTL (default: FALSE) label Accessible name component content_top Slot adding non-interactive elements component's content content_bottom Slot adding non-interactive elements component's content

title: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
text: Tiles best used represent one limited number options, actions, choices component wholly focusable - contain slotted focusable elements Text concise (heading max ~50 chars, description max ~175 chars) Use sentence case heading description End description proper punctuation

title: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
text: used Shiny app id, calcite_tile() returns reactive list containing component properties. Available properties: $active - Whether tile currently active $selected - Whether tile selected $disabled - Whether tile disabled $heading - heading text $description - description text $icon - icon name component properties

title: Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
Create a Calcite Tile Component — calcite_tile
code:
# Basic tile with icon and description calcite_tile( icon = "3d-glasses", heading = "Special viewing glasses", description = "Great for eclipses and optical illusions" ) #> # Tile with content in bottom slot calcite_tile( icon = "rangefinder", heading = "Rangefinder", description = "A time-tested tool for field engineers", content_bottom = calcite_chip("214 in use") ) #> #>
#> 214 in use #>
#> # Active tile with link calcite_tile( icon = "data", heading = "Data Analysis", href = "https://example.com/data", active = TRUE ) #>

what: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
title: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
text: Tile Group can used organize multiple Tile components within layout. supports workflows patterns using one Tile, opt-selection modes interactive workflows.

title: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
code: calcite_tile_group(   ...,   id = NULL,   label = NULL,   layout = NULL,   alignment = NULL,   scale = NULL,   selection_mode = NULL,   selection_appearance = NULL,   disabled = NULL )

title: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
text: ... Child calcite_tile() components id Optional ID tile group (required Shiny reactivity track selection) label Accessible name component (required accessibility) layout Defines layout: "horizontal" rows, "vertical" single column alignment Specifies alignment tile's content: "start" "center" scale Specifies size component: "s" (small), "m" (medium), "l" (large) selection_mode Specifies selection mode: "none" (default), "single", "single-persist", "multiple" selection_appearance Specifies selection appearance: "icon" (checkmark/dot) "border" disabled TRUE, interaction prevented component displays lower opacity (default: FALSE)

title: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
text: "none" - selection allowed (default) "single" - one tile can selected time "single-persist" - one tile selected, prevents de-selection "multiple" - number tiles can selected

title: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
text: used Shiny app id, calcite_tile_group() returns reactive list containing component properties emits events selection changes. Available properties: $selectedItems - Array selected tile IDs $selectionMode - Current selection mode $layout - Current layout $disabled - Whether group disabled component properties Usage server:
code: # Watch for selection changes observeEvent(input$my_tile_group$selectedItems, {   selected <- input$my_tile_group$selectedItems   message("Selected tiles: ", paste(selected, collapse = ", ")) })

title: Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
Create a Calcite Tile Group Component — calcite_tile_group
code: # Basic tile group calcite_tile_group(   label = "Role selection",   calcite_tile(     icon = "rangefinder",     heading = "Field operator",     description = "Create and edit Reports in the field"   ),   calcite_tile(     icon = "knowledge-graph-dashboard",     heading = "Office coordinator",     description = "View and analyze Reports from the office"   ) ) #> <calcite-tile-group label="Role selection"> #>   <calcite-tile heading="Field operator" description="Create and edit Reports in the field" icon="rangefinder"></calcite-tile> #>   <calcite-tile heading="Office coordinator" description="View and analyze Reports from the office" icon="knowledge-graph-dashboard"></calcite-tile> #> </calcite-tile-group>  # Tile group with multiple selection calcite_tile_group(   id = "role_selector",   label = "Select roles",   selection_mode = "multiple",   selection_appearance = "border",   layout = "vertical",   calcite_tile(     id = "construction",     icon = "wrench",     heading = "Construction Worker",     description = "Manage construction projects and coordinate teams"   ),   calcite_tile(     id = "engineer",     icon = "rangefinder",     heading = "Civil Engineer",     description = "Design infrastructure and ensure compliance"   ) ) #> <calcite-tile-group id="role_selector" label="Select roles" layout="vertical" selection-mode="multiple" selection-appearance="border"> #>   <calcite-tile id="construction" heading="Construction Worker" description="Manage construction projects and coordinate teams" icon="wrench"></calcite-tile> #>   <calcite-tile id="engineer" heading="Civil Engineer" description="Design infrastructure and ensure compliance" icon="rangefinder"></calcite-tile> #> </calcite-tile-group>

title: Calcite components version — calcite_version
text: Reports currently used calcite component version.

what: Create a Shell with Action Bar Layout — page_actionbar
title: Create a Shell with Action Bar Layout — page_actionbar
text: convenience function creates common layout pattern: shell navigation header collapsible action bar panel start (left) side. ideal map-based applications tools multiple layers/options.

title: Create a Shell with Action Bar Layout — page_actionbar
code: page_actionbar(   ...,   title = NULL,   header_actions = NULL,   actions = NULL,   panel_content = NULL,   panel_position = c("start", "end"),   panel_width = c("m", "s", "l"),   footer = NULL )

title: Create a Shell with Action Bar Layout — page_actionbar
text: ... Main content area (typically map primary view) title Application title shown navigation header header_actions Optional actions header (e.g., user menu, settings). placed content-end slot navigation. actions Action bar content. Either calcite_action_bar() component list calcite_action() components wrapped action bar. panel_content Content side panel (shown action selected). Can calcite_panel() content. panel_position Position panel. Either "start" (left) "end" (right). panel_width Width panel expanded. Options: "s", "m", "l". footer Optional footer content

title: Create a Shell with Action Bar Layout — page_actionbar
text: object class calcite_component containing configured shell

title: Create a Shell with Action Bar Layout — page_actionbar
code: page_actionbar(   title = "Wildlife Areas",   actions = calcite_action_bar(     calcite_action(text = "Add", icon = "plus"),     calcite_action(text = "Layers", icon = "layers", active = TRUE)   ),   panel_content = calcite_panel(     heading = "Layers",     "Layer controls here"   ),   "Map content here" ) #> <calcite-shell> #>   Map content here #>   <calcite-navigation slot="header"> #>     <calcite-navigation-logo slot="logo" heading="Wildlife Areas"></calcite-navigation-logo> #>   </calcite-navigation> #>   <calcite-shell-panel position="start" width="m" id="shell-panel-start" slot="panel-start"> #>     <calcite-action-bar slot="action-bar"> #>       <calcite-action text="Add" icon="plus"></calcite-action> #>       <calcite-action text="Layers" icon="layers" active="TRUE"></calcite-action> #>     </calcite-action-bar> #>     <calcite-panel heading="Layers">Layer controls here</calcite-panel> #>   </calcite-shell-panel> #> </calcite-shell>

title: Update Calcite Component Properties — update_calcite
text: id html ID element update. Must character scalar. ... named properties updated component. names must match property name. Otherwise, fail silently. session shiny session object. Default shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain().

title: Update Calcite Component Properties — update_calcite
text: NULL. Sends message shiny session object.

title: Update Calcite Component Properties — update_calcite
code: # this cannot work outside of shiny if (interactive()) { library(shiny) ui <- calcite_shell(   calcite_card(     heading = "Content",     calcite_label(       layout = "inline",       calcite_checkbox(id = "checked"),       "Click me"     )   ),   calcite_notice(     id = "initial-note",     div(slot = "title", "Nice!"),     div(slot = "message", "This is a success message")   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   observeEvent(input$checked_checked, {     checked <- input$checked_checked$values     # Update the `initial-note` property here     update_calcite("initial-note", open = checked)   }) }  # shinyApp(ui, server) }
